trans-unit.source: Provides a mechanism that data source controls use to bind to application variables, user identities and choices, and other data.
Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET parameter types.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class represents a parameter in a parameterized SQL query, a filtering expression, or a business object method call that an ASP.NET data source control uses to select, filter, or modify data.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects are contained in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> object.

<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects are evaluated at run time, to bind the values of the variables they represent to whatever method is used by a data source control to interact with data.
Use classes that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> with data source and data-bound controls to build Web-based data applications.
These parameter classes are used by data source controls to bind specific kinds of values found in Web applications to placeholders in SQL query strings, business object method parameters, and more.
The following table lists parameter types that are included in ASP.NET.
Binds any public property of a Web server control.
Binds a form field.
Binds a session-state field.
Binds a route URL parameter.
Binds a cookie field.
Binds a query-string parameter.
Binds a profile field.
Extend the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class when you want to implement your own custom parameter types.

<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects are very simple: they have a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property, can be represented declaratively, and can track state across multiple HTTP requests.
All parameters support a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property, for cases when a parameter is bound to a value, but the value evaluates to `null` at run time.
When using a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects with a data source control, their order in the collection might matter.

For more information on how parameters are used, see [Using Parameters with the SqlDataSource Control](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/403ff44a-dd0b-484d-968e-dcd1dcd4c295) and [Using Parameters with the ObjectDataSource Control](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/45fb67ee-9be7-49b7-9421-e242203dafa4).
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor> constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class, using the specified name.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.String%29> constructor is initialized with the specified `name` and default values for its other properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
The name of the parameter.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class with the values of the original, specified instance.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter%29> constructor is a `protected` copy constructor used to clone a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> instance.

The values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are all transferred to the new instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance from which the current instance is initialized.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class, using the specified name and database type.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Data.DbType%29> constructor is initialized with the specified `name` and `dbType` parameters, and with default values for other properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
The name of the parameter.
The database type of the parameter.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class, using the specified name and type.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.TypeCode%29> constructor is initialized with the specified `name` and `type` parameters, and default values for other properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
The name of the parameter.
A <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> that describes the type of the parameter.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class, using the specified name, the specified database type, and the specified value for its <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue"></xref> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> instance is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.
The database type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.

The default value for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance, if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> is bound to a value that is not yet initialized when <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> is called.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> class, using the specified name, the specified type, and the specified string for its <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue"></xref> property.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.TypeCode%2CSystem.String%29> constructor is initialized with the specified `name` parameter and `type` parameter, and assigned a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property value.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>.
The name of the parameter.
A <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> that describes the type of the parameter.

A string that serves as a default value for the parameter, if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> is bound to a value that is not yet initialized when <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> is called.
Returns a duplicate of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Clone%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter%29> copy constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class with the values of the current instance.

If you extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class, you can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Clone%2A> method to include any state that should be copied to a new instance of your derived class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> that is an exact duplicate of the current one.
Converts a <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value to an equivalent <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> value.
This method returns an <xref:System.TypeCode.Object> instance if no equivalent for the <xref:System.Data.DbType> value is found.
Database types without equivalent types include <xref:System.Data.DbType.Guid>, <xref:System.Data.DbType.Binary>, and <xref:System.Data.DbType.DateTimeOffset>.
A <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value to convert to an equivalent <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> value that is equivalent to the specified <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object is bound to should be converted to `null` if it is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> property of the parameter is changed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.

`true` if the value that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> is bound to should be converted to `null` when it is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Converts a <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> value to an equivalent <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value.
This method returns an <xref:System.Data.DbType.Object> instance if no equivalent is found.
Types without equivalent database types include <xref:System.TypeCode.DBNull> and <xref:System.TypeCode.Empty>.
The <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> value to convert to an equivalent <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value.
A <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value that is equivalent to the specified <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the database type of the parameter.
The database type can be used to create strongly typed parameters, so that values are converted correctly between your Web application and underlying code or values from database tables.

If the database type of the parameter is changed by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DbType%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
The database type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.
The default value is <xref href="System.Data.DbType.Object"></xref>.
An attempt was made to set this property to a value that is not in the <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> enumeration.

Specifies a default value for the parameter, should the value that the parameter is bound to be uninitialized when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> method is called.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is used in scenarios where the parameter is bound to a value, but the value is `null` or cannot be resolved when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is evaluated.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property of the parameter is changed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
A string that serves as a default value for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> when the value it is bound to cannot be resolved or is uninitialized.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object is used to bind a value to a control, or the control can be used to change the value.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is currently not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class and is reserved for future use.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property describes the direction of the flow of data between the value that a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> instance is bound to and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object itself.

The default value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property, <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, describes the most common scenario where the flow of data is always in one direction: from the value to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is bound to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object.

Any changes made to the underlying value are reflected by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object, but any changes to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object are not reflected by the underlying data.

You can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.InputOutput> or <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Output> when working with output parameters, or <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.ReturnValue> when working with a return value from a stored procedure.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property of the parameter is changed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.ParameterDirection"></xref> values.
<xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction"></xref> is set to <xref href="System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input"></xref> by default.
Updates and returns the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object.
The default implementation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate%2A> method is to return `null` in all cases.
Classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Evaluate%2A> method to return an updated parameter value.

For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ControlParameter> object returns the value of the control that it is bound to, while the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryStringParameter> object retrieves the current name/value pair from the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> of the request.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> the parameter is bound to.
If the parameter is not bound to a control, the control parameter is ignored.
An `object` that represents the updated and current value of the parameter.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value that is equivalent to the CLR type of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DbType%2A> property must not already have been set, or must be set to <xref:System.Data.DbType.Object>.
This method is intended for use only when the CLR type is set but the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DbType%2A> property is not.
The <xref href="System.Data.DbType"></xref> value that is equivalent to the CLR type of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DbType"></xref> property is already set to a value other than <xref href="System.Data.DbType.Object"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object is saving changes to its view state.
`true` if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, `false`.
Restores the data source view's previously saved view state.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).

This method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.SaveViewState%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> state to restore.
Gets or sets the name of the parameter.

<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> objects are not required to have a name; however, data source controls might use the parameter name to match a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object in a collection with a parameter in a SQL query or business method signature.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control can use the name of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object to match a placeholder in a parameterized SQL query.

Similarly, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control can use the name of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterParameters%2A> collection to match a placeholder in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.FilterExpression%2A> property.

In some cases, the name is not used and the order in which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is added to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection is more important.

For more information, see [Using Parameters with the SqlDataSource Control](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/403ff44a-dd0b-484d-968e-dcd1dcd4c295) and [Using Parameters with the ObjectDataSource Control](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/45fb67ee-9be7-49b7-9421-e242203dafa4).
If the name of the parameter is changed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
The name of the parameter.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.

Calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.OnParametersChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection"></xref> collection that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is not contained by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection, calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method has no effect.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object is contained by a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.ParametersChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event of the collection.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection> collection is contained by a data source control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.ParametersChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event raises the data source control's <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataSource.DataSourceChanged> event, causing any data-bound controls to rebind.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Saves the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object's view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties.
These values are automatically placed in the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle.
When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML `hidden` element.
When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ViewState%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> view state.
If there is no view state associated with the object, this method returns `null`.
Marks the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object so its state will be recorded in view state.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.SetDirty%2A> method is called directly by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ParameterCollection.SetDirtyObject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, to mark the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object so that its state is recorded in view state.
Gets or sets the size of the parameter.
When the value for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Size%2A> is changed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
The size of the parameter expressed as an integer.
Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ToString%2A> method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object has no name, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ToString%2A> returns <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
A string representation of the value of this instance.

Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object to track changes to its view state so they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> object and persisted across requests for the same page.
Gets or sets the type of the parameter.
The type can be used to create strongly typed parameters, so that values are converted correctly between your Web application and underlying code.
If the type of the parameter is changed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.OnParameterChanged%2A> method is called.
The type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref>.
The default value is <xref href="System.TypeCode.Object"></xref>.
The parameter type is not one of the <xref href="System.TypeCode"></xref> values.

Gets a dictionary of state information that allows you to save and restore the view state of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object across multiple requests for the same page.
A parameter's view state is the accumulation of all its property values.
To preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class, to store the property values.
The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML `hidden` input element when subsequent requests are processed.
View state is enabled for all server controls by default.
For more information about dictionaries and how to use them, see [Collections and Data Structures](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/60cc581f-1db5-445b-ba04-a173396bf872).
An instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object's view-state information.
Returns a duplicate of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> instance.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Clone%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter%29> constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class with the values of the current instance.

If you extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class, you can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Clone%2A> method to include any state that should be copied to a new instance of your derived class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> that is a copy of the current object.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object is saving changes to its view state.
`true` if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, `false`.
Restores the data source view's previously saved view state.

This method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> object from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.SaveViewState%2A> method.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
You can override this method to control how a custom server control restores its view state.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> state to restore.
Saves the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object's view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties.
These values are automatically placed in the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle.
When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML `hidden` element.
When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ViewState%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object's view state.
If there is no view state associated with the object, this method returns `null`.

Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> object to track changes to its view state so they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState"></xref> object and persisted across requests for the same page.
